description: Learn to separate business logic from UI using Services and Angular's powerful Dependency Injection system.

slides.title: What is a Service?
slides.content:
# Business Logic üß†

Components should handle the VIEW (UI).

Services should handle DATA and LOGIC.

Examples: Fetching data from API, validating user input, logging, sharing state between unrelated components.

slides.title: Creating a Service
Dependency Injection
slides.content:
# DI System üèóÔ∏è

Angular has a built-in DI framework.

Instead of `new HeroService()`, you ask for it in the constructor.

```typescript
constructor(private heroService: HeroService) {}
```
Angular automatically finds the instance and provides it.

slides.title: Singleton Services
slides.content:
# Singletons 1Ô∏è‚É£

When `providedIn: 'root'` is used, the service is a **Singleton**.

This means the SAME instance is shared across the entire application.

If Component A changes a value in the service, Component B sees the update.

slides.quizQuestion: Which decorator marks a class as a participant in the Dependency Injection system?

slides.title: HttpClient
Subscribing
Providers
slides.content:
# Custom Providers üîå

You can configure HOW the injection works.

```typescript
providers: [
  { provide: Logger, useClass: BetterLogger }
]
```
This tells Angular: "When a component asks for `Logger`, give it `BetterLogger` instead."

slides.title: Hierarchy
slides.content:
# Injector Tree üå≤

Dependency injection is hierarchical.

- **Root Injector:** Global (AppModule).
- **Component Injector:** If you provide a service in a Component's `providers: []` array, a NEW instance is created just for that component and its children.

slides.title: Interceptors
slides.content:
# Interceptors üïµÔ∏è

A powerful HTTP feature.

Intercept all outgoing requests (e.g., to add an Auth Token header) or incoming responses (to catch global 401 errors).

Implement `HttpInterceptor` interface.

slides.content:
# Recap: Services üéì

Logic Layer.

- **@Injectable:** Makes class injectable.
- **providedIn: 'root':** Singleton.
- **Constructor Injection:** `private srv: Service`.
- **HttpClient:** Returns Observables.
- **Interceptors:** Global HTTP handling.
